services.name: SceneWise: AI-Powered Script Breakdown and Scheduling
services.overview: SceneWise is an AI-driven platform designed to revolutionize the pre-production process for film and television projects. By leveraging natural language processing (NLP), SceneWise automates script breakdown, identifying key elements such as characters, props, locations, and actions with unparalleled accuracy. The system then intelligently synthesizes this data with resource availability, actor schedules, and location logistics to generate optimized shooting schedules. SceneWise minimizes manual effort, reduces scheduling conflicts, and provides real-time progress tracking, empowering production teams to streamline workflows, reduce costs, and enhance overall production efficiency. This comprehensive tool moves beyond simple scheduling software, integrating AI-powered insights to anticipate and mitigate potential delays and optimize resource allocation proactively.
problems_addressed: Time-consuming and error-prone manual script breakdown processes.
Scheduling conflicts arising from incomplete or inaccurate data.
Inefficient resource allocation leading to budget overruns and production delays.
core_features: Automated Script Breakdown: Utilizes NLP to automatically identify and tag characters, props, locations, actions, and other relevant elements within a script, eliminating the need for manual analysis. This feature includes a user-friendly interface for reviewing and refining the AI-generated breakdown.

Optimized Shooting Schedule Generation: Generates optimized shooting schedules based on complex constraints, including actor availability, location permits, equipment rentals, and weather conditions. The algorithm prioritizes efficiency, minimizing location moves and optimizing actor utilization.

Resource Management: Integrates with resource databases to track availability and cost of equipment, crew, and other production resources. This allows for informed decision-making and efficient allocation of resources.

Conflict Detection and Resolution: Identifies potential scheduling conflicts in real-time, such as overlapping actor schedules or location permit issues. The system suggests alternative solutions and facilitates conflict resolution.

Real-time Progress Tracking and Alerts: Provides real-time progress tracking against the generated schedule. Automated alerts notify users of potential delays or deviations from the planned timeline, enabling proactive intervention.

Integration with Production Management Software: Seamless integration with industry-standard production management software (e.g., Movie Magic Scheduling, StudioBinder) to facilitate data exchange and streamline workflows. This includes API access for custom integrations.
user_journeys: A producer logs into SceneWise, uploads a script, and initiates the automated breakdown process. The system analyzes the script, identifies key elements, and presents a detailed breakdown for review. The producer then inputs resource availability (actor schedules, location permits, equipment rentals) and generates an optimized shooting schedule. The system flags any potential conflicts or inefficiencies, allowing the producer to adjust the schedule accordingly. Throughout the production, the producer monitors progress in real-time, receiving alerts for potential delays and making necessary adjustments to ensure the project stays on track and within budget.
ai_capabilities: NLP for Script Analysis: Uses a transformer-based NLP model (e.g., BERT, RoBERTa, or a fine-tuned version of these models) to analyze the script and identify key elements. The model is trained on a large dataset of film and television scripts to ensure high accuracy and recall.

Optimization Algorithm for Schedule Generation: Employs a constraint satisfaction optimization algorithm (e.g., genetic algorithm, simulated annealing) to generate optimized shooting schedules. The algorithm considers a variety of constraints, including actor availability, location permits, equipment rentals, and weather conditions.

Anomaly Detection for Progress Tracking: Utilizes anomaly detection techniques (e.g., time series analysis, machine learning classifiers) to identify potential delays or deviations from the planned timeline. The system learns from historical production data to improve the accuracy of its predictions.

Sentiment Analysis for Script Elements: Employs sentiment analysis models to understand the emotional tone of scenes, assisting in casting and performance direction. This leverages pre-trained models from Hugging Face Transformers or custom-trained models based on script corpora.

Entity Recognition for Props and Wardrobe: Fine-tuned named entity recognition (NER) models to specifically identify and categorize props, wardrobe items, and other production assets mentioned in the script. This enhances the accuracy of asset tracking and management.

input_data_types: Film and television scripts (in formats such as .pdf, .fdx, .docx)
Actor availability schedules (in formats such as .csv, .xlsx, or iCalendar)
Location permits (details including dates, times, and restrictions)
Equipment rental agreements (details including availability and cost)
Production budget (spreadsheet or accounting software export)
Historical production data (previous schedules, actual shooting times, cost data)
data_schema_recommendations: Scripts: Standard screenplay format with clear scene headings and character names.
Actors: Table with columns for actor name, contact information, availability, and character.
Locations: Table with columns for location name, address, permit details, and restrictions.
Equipment: Table with columns for equipment name, rental cost, availability, and vendor.
Scenes: Table with scene ID, location ID, character IDs, description, and estimated shooting time.
data_sources: Integrated actor scheduling systems (e.g., Google Calendar, iCalendar)
Publicly available film datasets for model training (e.g., scripts, production schedules).
data_requirements.privacy_and_compliance: Adherence to GDPR, CCPA, and other relevant data privacy regulations. Secure storage and encryption of user data. Anonymization of historical production data used for model training. Compliance with union regulations regarding actor scheduling and working hours.

required_integrations: Slack or Microsoft Teams for notifications
Payment gateways for subscription billing (e.g., Stripe, PayPal).
integration_plan.authentication_strategy: JWT (JSON Web Tokens) for API authentication. OAuth 2.0 for integration with third-party services (e.g., Google Calendar). Clerk for user authentication and management, providing features like multi-factor authentication and social login.

technical_specifications.architecture: A multi-tiered architecture consisting of a frontend, backend, database, and AI pipeline. The frontend provides a user interface for uploading scripts, reviewing breakdowns, and generating schedules. The backend handles user authentication, data storage, and API requests. The database stores script data, actor schedules, location permits, and equipment rentals. The AI pipeline performs script analysis, schedule optimization, and progress tracking.

recommended_tech_stack.frontend: Next.js 14 App Router, TypeScript, TailwindCSS, shadcn/ui, Vercel conventions. Use React Context for state management.
recommended_tech_stack.backend: Node.js / Next.js server actions / Vercel serverless functions. Implement API endpoints using REST or GraphQL.
recommended_tech_stack.database: Planetscale / Supabase / PostgreSQL with schema notes. Consider using Supabase vectors for storing and querying script embeddings.
recommended_tech_stack.storage: Supabase storage / AWS S3 / Vercel Blob for storing uploaded scripts and other media assets.
recommended_tech_stack.AI: OpenAI API for NLP tasks, including script analysis and summarization. Sentence Transformers for generating script embeddings. Pinecone or Supabase vectors for vector similarity search.
recommended_tech_stack.APIs: REST API for communication between frontend and backend. GraphQL API for querying data and integrating with third-party services.
recommended_tech_stack.CI_CD: GitHub â†’ Vercel automatic deploy pipeline for continuous integration and continuous deployment.

API_design: POST /api/scripts: Upload a script and initiate the automated breakdown process. Payload: { script_file: File } Response: { script_id: string }
GET /api/scripts/{script_id}: Retrieve the script breakdown. Response: { script_id: string, breakdown: object }
POST /api/schedules/{script_id}: Generate an optimized shooting schedule. Payload: { actor_availability: array, location_permits: array, equipment_rentals: array } Response: { schedule: array }
GET /api/schedules/{script_id}: Retrieve the generated shooting schedule. Response: { schedule: array }
PUT /api/schedules/{script_id}: Update the shooting schedule. Payload: { schedule: array } Response: { schedule: array }
GET /api/resources: Retrieve available resources (actors, locations, equipment). Response: { actors: array, locations: array, equipment: array }
POST /api/resources: Add new resources to the system. Payload: { type: string, data: object } Response: { resource_id: string }
frontend_components: Script Uploader: A component for uploading scripts and displaying progress. Drag-and-drop functionality.
Script Breakdown Viewer: A component for viewing and editing the script breakdown. Interactive display of identified elements.
Schedule Generator: A component for generating and customizing the shooting schedule. Gantt chart representation.
Conflict Resolver: A component for identifying and resolving scheduling conflicts. Visual representation of conflicts and suggested solutions.
Progress Tracker: A component for tracking progress against the generated schedule. Real-time updates and alerts.
Resource Manager: A component for managing actors, locations, equipment, and other production resources. CRUD operations.

deployment_instructions: Environment variables: OPENAI_API_KEY, DATABASE_URL, SUPABASE_URL, SUPABASE_ANON_KEY, CLERK_SECRET_KEY
Vercel deployment: Connect GitHub repository to Vercel. Configure environment variables. Enable automatic deployments on push.
Build outputs: Frontend: Next.js static export. Backend: Serverless functions. AI pipeline: Pre-trained models and configuration files.
Runtime settings: Node.js version, Python version (for AI pipeline), memory allocation, timeout settings.

pricing_strategy: SaaS subscription tiers: Free (limited features), Basic, Premium, Enterprise. Tiered pricing based on the number of scripts processed per month, storage capacity, and number of users.
Usage-based pricing: Pay-per-script processing for occasional users.
Add-ons: Additional features such as custom integrations, priority support, and on-site training.

success_metrics: Operational KPIs: Number of active users, customer acquisition cost, churn rate, monthly recurring revenue.
AI performance KPIs: Script breakdown accuracy (precision and recall), schedule optimization efficiency (reduction in shooting days), conflict detection accuracy.
Adoption/engagement KPIs: Number of scripts processed, number of schedules generated, average session duration, feature usage (script breakdown, schedule optimization, conflict resolution).
